text: The Gartempe is a French river that flows through the Nouvelle-Aquitaine and Centre-Val de Loire regions. It rises in the Massif Central and flows into the Creuse river, as a left tributary, in the Vienne department. ==Geography== The Gartempe river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . ===Course=== The Gartempe river starts in western Massif Central, near the hamlet of Pétillat in the commune of Peyrabout, Creuse department, at an elevation of about . From here, it generally flows to the northwest. Finally, the river flows into the Creuse river in La Roche-Posay (Vienne department, on the left side) and Yzeures-sur-Creuse (Indre-et-Loire department, on the right side). The Gartempe flows through 5 departments and 46 communes, in 2 regions: * Centre-Val de Loire region ** Indre: Néons-sur- Creuse ** Indre-et-Loire: Yzeures-sur-Creuse * Nouvelle-Aquitaine region ** Creuse: Peyrabout, Le Grand-Bourg ** Haute-Vienne: Châteauponsac, Rancon ** Vienne: Montmorillon, Saint-Savin, La Roche-Posay ==Main tributaries == The main tributaries of the Gartempe river are: Left tributaries: * Ardour - 33.5 km * Couze - 35.2 km * Vincou - 50.4 km Right tributaries: * Anglin - 91.3 km * Brame - 60.4 km * Semme - 50.3 km ==Gallery== Gartempe1.jpg|The Gartempe in Portes d'Enfer Gartempe Montmorillon Pont république.jpg|The Gartempe in Montmorillon Saint-Savin abbaye (1).jpg|The Saint-Savin-sur-Gartempe abbey ConfluentGartempe-Creuse.JPG|Confluence with the Creuse river ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France ==References== ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station L5411810 - La Gartempe à Montmorillon * Bassin versant de la Gartempe * Syndicat intercommunal d'aménagement de la Gartempe (SIAG) Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Rivers of Centre-Val de Loire
